item.title: Recycling Vim Macros
item.description: Vim macros are neat[1]. The ability to write, store, and repeat arbitrary operations by doing them in the editor once is one of the primary reasons I use vim for (almost) everything I write. Lint errors[2], on the other hand, are not neat. In the project my team has been working at Khan Academy for the past few months, we’ve been doing a lot of code reorganization and moving files around.
